intro: Sphacele affinis, commonly known as the common sphacele, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a pinnate arrangement. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to various regions in Europe and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. Sphacele affinis is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
